The goal of slackblocks is to build Slack block elements in `R`.

## Installation

``` r
# install.packages("remotes")
remotes::install_github("yonicd/slackblocks")
```
## Example

This is a basic example which shows you how to solve a common problem:

```{r example}
library(slackblocks)
library(magrittr)
```

```{r}
slackblocks::block_text('my text')
```

```{r}
slackblocks::block_image('url_to_image')
```

```{r}
(b <- block_section(
  text = block_text(
    text = 'A message *with some bold text* and _some italicized text_.'),
  fields = list(
    block_text('*Priority*'),
    block_text('*Type*'),
    block_text('High'),
    block_text(':heavy_check_mark:')
    )
  ))
```

## Posting Blocks to Slack

```{r,eval=FALSE}
post_block(b,channel = 'yonicd')
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics('man/figures/sections.png')
```

## Reprex

```{r,eval = FALSE}
slackteams::load_team_dcf(team = 'r4ds')
slackteams::activate_team('r4ds')
```

```{r,eval=FALSE}
slackblocks::slack_reprex({
  x <- 10
  hist(runif(x))
  hist(runif(2*y))
},
text = 'My question is ...) ',
channel = 'yonicd')
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
knitr::include_graphics('man/figures/plot_example.png')
```

## Reprex Under the Hood

### Convert reprex `gh` output to slack blocks

```{r}
reprex_block <- reprex::reprex({
x <- 10
hist(runif(x))
hist(runif(2*y))
},
venue = 'gh', advertise = FALSE, show = FALSE)%>%
reprex_to_blocks()
```

```{r, echo=FALSE}
reprex_block
```

### post the blocks

```{r, eval = FALSE}
reprex_block%>%
  post_block(
    channel = 'yonicd'
  )
```

### Post with a question and attach the reprex into a thread.

```{r}
q_txt <- block_text(
  text = 'My Question is ...'
)
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
q_txt
```

```{r,eval  = FALSE}

q_txt%>%
post_block(
  channel = 'yonicd'
    )%>%
post_thread(
  block = reprex_block
)
```
